subject: Medicine
title: Clinical Trials
description: A short lesson to help you apply Clinical Trials.

hook.text: Before any drug reaches you, it's tested on thousands of volunteers in carefully controlled experiments.

buildup.text: Clinical trials have four phases: safety testing, dosing, efficacy comparison, and long-term monitoring.

discovery.text: Phase 3 trials compare the new drug to placebo or existing treatment using randomized, blinded groups.

twist.text: Only about 10% of drugs that enter clinical trials ever get approved. Most fail in Phase 2 or 3.

climax.text: Phase 4 monitoring continues after approvalâ€”rare side effects may only appear once millions take the drug.

punchline.text: Approval isn't the finish line. Monitoring never ends.

quiz.question: What happens during Phase 4 of a clinical trial?
options: Long-term monitoring after the drug is approved and in public use
The first safety tests on healthy volunteers
Comparison of the drug to a placebo in large groups
